title.narrative: WASH IN SCHOOLS AND CLINICS

description.narrative: Sustained access to and use of water, sanitation and hygiene practices for all children and young people particularly the most disadvantaged and those living in humanitarian situations:, which contributes to Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children, adolescents and their families, especially the most vulnerable, have improved access to sustainable, equitable and safely managed water, sanitation and hygiene services including in most vulnerable communities.

participating-org.narrative: DIRECTORATE OF ERBIL SURROUNDING WA DESW

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

sector.narrative: Hygiene - handwashing with soap in communities
Sanitation - improving services in peri-urban and urban communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH in emergencies - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) response including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Sustained access to and use of water, sanitation and hygiene practices for all children and young people particularly the most disadvantaged and those living in humanitarian situations:
Number of districts implementing Handwashing behaviour-change programmes at community level
Number of school children with access to basic WASH service in schools in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
Number of Health centres (clinics, hospitals, etc.) provided with WASH facilities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
